thread.title: Midi TV Awards to Recognise and Celebrate Musical Talent in Devon | The Exeter Daily
thread.title_full: Midi TV Awards to Recognise and Celebrate Musical Talent in Devon | The Exeter Daily

title: Midi TV Awards to Recognise and Celebrate Musical Talent in Devon | The Exeter Daily
text: Midi TV Awards to Recognise and Celebrate Musical Talent in Devon Community arts enterprise the Music in Devon Initiative CIC (MIDI) are delighted to announce that the first “Midi TV Awards” will be held at Bomba on Exeter Quay, Friday January 26th from 7.30pm. MIDI TV is an online TV Station, akin to MTV for Devon. The MIDI TV awards aim to recognise and celebrate the huge amount of musical talent in Devon, with awards across 10 categories for the public to vote for. There will be an announcement in mid-January about five Devon bands performing alongside the awards, hosted by a comedian, with a panel made up of local music industry leaders. The Award Categories are below, all of which can be found on the MIDI website, with links for the public to nominate their favourite musicians for an award; [https://www.musicindevon.org/miditv-music-awards](https://www.musicindevon.org/miditv-music-awards). Nominations close on 15th January. - Best Live Act - Best Single - Best Album - Best Video - Best Rock Band - Best Hip Hop Artist - Best Producer - Best DJ - Best New Band - Legend Award A truly unmissable event, the MIDI TV Awards will celebrate not only the huge amount of musical talent in Devon, but also the resilience of the South West music scene, which not only survived the pandemic, but has bounced back, is now thriving and preparing for an even bigger and better musical 2024 than ever before. “MIDI are delighted to be launching the very first MIDI TV Awards. After a few tough years for the Devon Music Scene, we are hoping to both showcase the sheer quantity of hugely talented musicians in the South West Music Scene and to celebrate the resilience of everyone in the industry. We have not only survived, but have bounced back and are thriving. What better way to celebrate this than bringing together key players and music lovers from across the South West, to kick-start 2024?”, says Nick Hall, Director of Music in Devon Initiative (MIDI). “We want YOU to help us pick the nominees. Check out the forms on our website, and let us know which local legends deserve the spotlight. Get ready to shout out your favourites and make Devon's music scene shine!” continues Nick. The Midi TV Awards are part of The Midi stages project in partnership with In Exeter supported by Youth Music’s trailblazer fund to help develop opportunities for under 25’s to earn and learn in the Music. Young people from Midi’s Soundtribe project will be involved in organising and performing at the event. Tickets for the Awards Ceremony are £20 from Fatsoma, which include a free drink on arrival at Bomba. Doors are at 8.30pm for a 2am close.
